TO DEVELOP A MARKET RESEARCH STRATEGY THAT USAID CAN BE UTILIZED IN THE DECISION-MAKING FOR PRIORITIZING AND CONTINUING INVESTMENTS IN THE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF BNABS FOR HIV PREVENTION IN ADULTS, ASSUMING LONG-ACTING INJECTABLE ARVS ON THE MARKET, AS WELL AS FOR POSTNATAL PROPHYLAXIS TO INFANTS. 
 
 A DETAILED SLIDE DECK THAT ANSWERS THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS: 
 
 WHAT IS THE RANGE OF REALISTIC TIMELINES IN WHICH A BNAB PRODUCT FOR HIV PREVENTION OF SEXUAL TRANSMISSION AND/OR POST-NATAL PROPHYLAXIS TO INFANTS COULD BE APPROVED AND INTRODUCED IN COUNTRIES WITH THE HIGHEST INCIDENCE OF HIV IN AFRICA? 
 
 WHAT ARE THE KEY MILESTONES FOR THIS TO HAPPEN AND WHICH MILESTONES ARE THE MOST UNCERTAIN/RISKIEST AND MOST LIKELY TO AFFECT THE TIMELINE?Â ¯ 
 
 WHAT ARE THE TRADEOFFS IN TERMS OF TIMELINES, COST, AND EXPECTED EFFICACY BETWEEN A BNAB COMBINATION CONTAINING TWO BNABS TO A COMBINATION CONTAINING THREE BNABS TO A SINGLE, TRI-SPECIFIC BNAB? 
 
 WITH THE CURRENT PIPELINE OF AVAILABLE AND EXPECTED LONG-ACTING INJECTABLE ARVS IN THE PIPELINE IN THE NEAR HORIZON, WILL THERE BE A CONTINUED SUBSTANTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH NEED OR NICHE FOR BNABS FOR: A) PREVENTION OF SEXUAL TRANSMISSION OF HIV IN ADULTS AND B) POST-NATAL PROPHYLAXIS TO INFANTS. FOR ADULTS, PLEASE EXPLORE THE POTENTIAL OF BOTH AN INTRAVENOUSLY ADMINISTERED PRODUCT AND A SUBCUTANEOUS OR INTRAMUSCULAR PRODUCT FOR BNABS. 
 
 WHAT IS THE PROBABILITY THAT EITHER MULTINATIONALS OR LMIC MANUFACTURERS WOULD ENGAGE IN DEVELOPMENT OF BNABS AS PRODUCTS FOR HIV PREVENTION OF SEXUAL TRANSMISSION AND OR POST-NATAL PROPHYLAXIS TO INFANTS? 
 
 4. WHAT WOULD THE COGS OF BNABS NEED TO BE FOR THEM TO BE COMPETITIVE WITH LONG-ACTING INJECTABLE ARVS IN LMIC? 
 
 WHAT ARE THE PROJECTED COGS FOR BNABS FOR POST-NATAL PROPHYLAXIS TO INFANTS? 
 
 WHAT ARE THE PROJECTED COGS FOR BNABS FOR HIV PREVENTION IN ADULTS? 
 
 HOW COULD THE USE OF BNABS FOR HIV TREATMENT AFFECT THE COST AND AVAILABILITY OF BNABS FOR PREVENTION IF THE SAME BNABS ARE UTILIZED IN BOTH INDICATIONS? 
 
 EXPECTED OUTCOMES 
 
 USAID WILL HAVE EVIDENCE-BASED INFORMATION REGARDING THE MARGINAL VALUE ADD OF BNABS ONCE LEN-PREP IS INTRODUCED AND WE HOPE THAT THE ANALYSIS GUIDES ON WHICH PRODUCTS AND TECHNOLOGIES TO CONTINUE TO INVEST IN.Â ¯Â ¯Â ¯

subaward_description:
THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (HHS), OFFICE OF THE ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR HEALTH (OASH) HAS CONTRACTED WITH THE MITRE CORPORATION (MITRE), AS OPERATOR OF THE CENTERS FOR MEDICARE & MEDICAID SERVICES (CMS) ALLIANCE TO MODERNIZE HEALTHCARE (CAMH) FEDERALLY FUNDED RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT CENTER (FFRDC), TO PROVIDE INDEPENDENT AND OBJECTIVE ADVICE, GUIDANCE, ASSISTANCE, AND FFRDC SUPPORT SERVICES FOR THE SMARTOOL PILOT REPLICATION PROJECT.
 
 THIS PROJECT REQUIRES MITRE AND ITS SUBCONTRACTORS, THE RESEARCH TRIANGLE INSTITUTE, INTERNATIONAL (RTI) AND ATLAS RESEARCH, INC. (ATLAS), TO: 
 Ï¿½ REVISE THE SYSTEMATIC METHOD FOR ASSESSING RISK-AVOIDANCE TOOL (SMARTOOL) TO REFLECT THE MOST CURRENT RESEARCH EVIDENCE, AND
 Ï¿½ DESIGN AND CONDUCT A FORMATIVE EVALUATION TO ASSESS SHORT-TERM CHANGES AMONG PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS REGARDING KEY SMARTOOL TARGETS, SUCH AS PERSONAL INTENTION AND COMMITMENT TO AVOID SEXUAL ACTIVITY, PERSONAL COMPETENCIES AND SELF-EFFICACY TO AVOID SEXUAL ACTIVITY, AND PERSONAL ATTITUDES AND BELIEFS THAT VALUE SEXUAL RISK AVOIDANCE.
 
 THE SMARTOOL PROGRAM TOOL, RELEASED IN 2008, PROVIDES A FRAMEWORK GROUNDED IN RESEARCH FOR CHOOSING A SEXUAL RISK AVOIDANCE (SRA) CURRICULUM AND IMPLEMENTING A SUCCESSFUL SRA APPROACH.  CURRENTLY, IT IS USED BY SCHOOLS, YOUTH-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS, AND OTHER AGENCIES INTERESTED IN PRESENTING RISK-AVOIDANCE EDUCATION TO YOUTH. AS OF JULY 2018, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE CENTER FOR RELATIONSHIP EDUCATION, MITRE (AND ITS SUBCONTRACTORS: RTI AND ATLAS) HAVE COMPLETED ONE ROUND OF REVISIONS TO THE SMARTOOL WHICH RESULTED IN THE RELEASE OF SMARTOOL SUMMARY DOCUMENT.  THE SMARTOOL 2.0 IS ORGANIZED INTO TEN TARGETS AND PRESENTS A FRAMEWORK OF EVIDENCE-INFORMED STRATEGIES MOST LIKELY TO ACHIEVE POSITIVE BEHAVIORS AND ATTITUDES RELATED TO SEXUAL RISK TAKING.
 REMAINING ACTIVITIES ON THE SMARTOOL PILOT REPLICATION PROJECT INCLUDE: 
 Ï¿½ A FORMATIVE EVALUATION INVOLVING UP TO FOUR (4) ORGANIZATIONS IMPLEMENTING SRA CURRICULA THAT ALIGN WITH THE SMARTOOL 2.0. 
 Ï¿½ A SECOND ROUND OF UPDATES TO THE SMARTOOL INFORMED BY THE FINDINGS OF THE FORMATIVE EVALUATION TO DEVELOP SMARTOOL 3.0.
 OASH REQUESTED THAT THE FORMATIVE EVALUATION ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING THREE (3) GOALS:
 Ï¿½ TO COLLECT INFORMATION ABOUT THE DELIVERY OF SRA CURRICULA THAT ALIGN WITH THE SMARTOOLÏ¿½INCLUDING QUALITY, ADHERENCE TO THE CONTENT AND TEACHING METHODS, AND PARTICIPANT SATISFACTION;
 Ï¿½ TO ASSESS SHORT-TERM CHANGES AMONG PARTICIPANTS IN THE YOUTH PROGRAM REGARDING KEY SMARTOOL TARGETS, SUCH AS PERSONAL INTENTION AND COMMITMENT TO AVOID SEXUAL ACTIVITY, PERSONAL COMPETENCIES AND SELF-EFFICACY TO AVOID SEXUAL ACTIVITY, AND PERSONAL ATTITUDES AND BELIEFS THAT VALUE SEXUAL RISK AVOIDANCE; AND 
 Ï¿½ TO DEVELOP AND TEST BASELINE AND FOLLOW-UP YOUTH SURVEYS THAT ALIGN WITH KEY TOPICS IN THE SMARTOOL THAT MAY BE USED IN THE FUTURE AS A MODEL FOR UNIFORM DATA COLLECTION.
 TO ACCOMPLISH OASHÏ¿½S GOALS FOR THE FORMATIVE EVALUATION, MITRE WILL CONTRACT WITH MULTIPLE CONTRACTORS (ALSO REFERRED TO AS Ï¿½IMPLEMENTING ORGANIZATIONSÏ¿½ (IOS)), DEFINED AS ORGANIZATIONS FOCUSED ON HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND SOCIAL SERVICES THAT HAVE EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH SCHOOLS OR SCHOOL DISTRICTS OR COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO IMPLEMENT SRA PROGRAMMING. IN THE FALL OF 2018, THE IOS WILL DEVELOP THEIR PLANS TO IMPLEMENT SRA PROGRAMMING. MITRE (AND ITS SUBCONTRACTORS) WILL WORK WITH EACH IO TO REFINE THEIR PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION PLANS AND PREPARE FOR THE FORMATIVE EVALUATION STUDY. IN THE SPRING OF 2019, EACH IO WILL IMPLEMENT THEIR SRA PROGRAMMING, COLLECT PROCESS EVALUATION DATA ABOUT THEIR PROGRAMS, AND FACILITATE MITREÏ¿½S COLLECTION OF OUTCOME EVALUATION DATA.  TABLE 1 PRESENTS A SCHEDULE OF DELIVERABLES FROM ALL TASKS TO SUPPORT THE WORK REQUIRED BY MITRE.
 
 TO QUALIFY FOR PARTICIPATION, IO MUST HAVE PLANS TO IMPLEMENT SRA CURRICULA  WITH YOUTH IN 9TH GRADE AND/OR 10TH GRADE DURING THE FALL OF 2019. MITRE AND OASH EXPECT FUNDED IOS TO FORM PARTNERSHIPS TO SUPPORT THE PROJECT.

THE SMARTOOL 2.0 IS ORGANIZED INTO TEN TARGETS AND PRESENTS A FRAMEWORK OF EVIDENCE-INFORMED STRATEGIES MOST LIKELY TO ACHIEVE POSITIVE BEHAVIORS AND ATTITUDES RELATED TO SEXUAL RISK TAKING.
 
 REMAINING ACTIVITIES ON THE SMARTOOL PILOT REPLICATION PROJECT INCLUDE: 
   A FORMATIVE EVALUATION INVOLVING UP TO FOUR (4) ORGANIZATIONS IMPLEMENTING SRA CURRICULA THAT ALIGN WITH THE SMARTOOL 2.0. 
   A SECOND ROUND OF UPDATES TO THE SMARTOOL INFORMED BY THE FINDINGS OF THE FORMATIVE EVALUATION TO DEVELOP SMARTOOL 3.0.

   TO COLLECT INFORMATION ABOUT THE DELIVERY OF SRA CURRICULA THAT ALIGN WITH THE SMARTOOL INCLUDING QUALITY, ADHERENCE TO THE CONTENT AND TEACHING METHODS, AND PARTICIPANT SATISFACTION;

   TO DEVELOP AND TEST BASELINE AND FOLLOW-UP YOUTH SURVEYS THAT ALIGN WITH KEY TOPICS IN THE SMARTOOL THAT MAY BE USED IN THE FUTURE AS A MODEL FOR UNIFORM DATA COLLECTION.
 TO ACCOMPLISH OASH S GOALS FOR THE FORMATIVE EVALUATION, MITRE WILL CONTRACT WITH MULTIPLE IMPLEMENTING ORGANIZATIONS (IOS), DEFINED AS ORGANIZATIONS FOCUSED ON HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND SOCIAL SERVICES THAT HAVE EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH SCHOOLS OR SCHOOL DISTRICTS OR COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO IMPLEMENT SRA PROGRAMMING. IN THE FALL OF 2018, THE IOS WILL DEVELOP THEIR PLANS TO IMPLEMENT SRA PROGRAMMING. MITRE (AND ITS SUBCONTRACTORS) WILL WORK WITH EACH IO TO REFINE THEIR PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION PLANS AND PREPARE FOR THE FORMATIVE EVALUATION STUDY. IN THE SPRING OF 2019, EACH IO WILL IMPLEMENT THEIR SRA PROGRAMMING, COLLECT PROCESS EVALUATION DATA ABOUT THEIR PROGRAMS, AND FACILITATE MITRE S COLLECTION OF OUTCOME EVALUATION DATA.

 PROGRAM ACTIVITIES TARGETING PLHIV
 
 
 1. WORKING WITH PATIENTS LOST TO FOLLOW UP (LTFU) TO ENROLL THEM INTO HIV CARE AND TREATMENT SERVICES.

 11. CONDUCTING LARGE-SCALE INFORMATION AND EDUCATIONAL EVENTS DEVOTED TO WORLD AIDS DAY, MEMORIAL DAY OF PEOPLE WHO DIED FROM AIDS.

 16. REFERRING PLHIV/GBV TO MEDICAL FACILITIES, SHELTERS, CRISIS CENTERS.

TO ALLOW FACULTY MEMBERS TO PERFORM RESEARCH ON DE-IDENTIFIED SAMPLES AND DATA COLLECTED UNDER THE CONIMPREG PROTOCOL IN NORWAY. THIS STUDY INCLUDES WOMEN WHO PLAN ON BECOMING PREGNANT AND THEN CONCEIVE, THE FATHER OF THE CHILD, AS WELL AS THE NEONATE/CHILD. THIS PROJECT WILL INVESTIGATE IF, AND POSSIBLY HOW THE INTERVAL BETWEEN CONCEPTION AND IMPLANTATION IN THE UTERUS CAN AFFECT EMBRYONIC DEVELOPMENT, FETAL GROWTH RATE, AND GESTATIONAL AGE; AND HOW FACTORS PRESENT IN THE MOTHER, FATHER, AND ENVIRONMENT AFFECT THE OFFSPRING'S DEVELOPMENT AND GROWTH. IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE STUDY WILL PROVIDE BETTER INSIGHT INTO THE MECHANISMS THAT DETERMINE HEALTH AND RISK OF DISEASE LATER IN LIFE. 
 
 STUDY AIMS:
 Â ¢TO ESTABLISH LONGITUDINAL FETAL AND CHILD GROWTH CHARTS BASED ON EMBRYONIC AGE
 Â ¢TO DETERMINE THE INTERVAL BETWEEN CONCEPTION AND IMPLANTATION
 Â ¢TO DETERMINE THE EFFECT OF IMPLANTATION VARIATION ON EMBRYONIC/FETAL GROWTH AND PREGNANCY DURATION
 Â ¢TO ASSESS PLACENTAL VOLUME, YOLLC SAC SIZE, AMNIOTIC AND COELOMIC VOLUME IN RELATION TO CONCEPTIONÂ IMPLANTATION TIME, FETAL GROWTH, BITTH WEIGHT AND PREGNANCY DURATION
 Â ¢TO DEVELOP NEW BIOMARKERS BASED ON URINE PROTEOMICS FOR A MORE PRECISE DETERMIT1ATION OFCONCEPTION- IMPLANTATION TITNE
 Â ¢TO ESTABLISH LONGITUDINAL REFERENCE RANGES FOR NUTRIENTS AND METABOLITES DURING PREGNANCY
 Â ¢TO ASSESS THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THESE NUTRIENTS AND METABOLITES AND FETAL AND CHILD GROWTH
 Â ¢TO REGISTER SEXUAL ACTIVITY BETWEEN OVULATION AND IMPLANTATION AND ITS EFFECT ON THE DURATION OF THIS INTERVAL
 Â ¢TO EVALUATE MATERNAL PRE-CONCEPTIONAL FACTORS (BODY COMPOSITION, BODY MASS INDEX, LEVEL OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND NUTRITION) IT1 RELATION TO CONCEPTION-IMPLANTATION INTERVAL, PREGNANCY DURATION AND FETAL AND CHILD GROWTH
 Â ¢TO DETERMINE THE PRESENCE OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINANTS AND THEIR ASSOCIATION WITH GROWTH VARIATION
 Â ¢TO EXPLORE EPIGENETIC EXPRESSION AND MODIFICATION TRIAGED BETWEEN MOTHER, FATHER AND CHILD CONCERNING BODY COMPOSITION, MORPHOMETRY, GROWTH AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY
 Â ¢TO ESTABLISH A BIOBANK THAT CAN SERVE FOR FURTHER TESTING OF HYPOTHESES CONCERNIT1G EPIGENETIC EXPRESSION, TOXIC EFFECTS AND METABOLIC/ENDOCRINE SETTING IN THE CHILD
 Â ¢TO EXPLORE ASSOCIATION OF GENES KNOWN OR SUSPECTED TO AFFECT GROWTH (E.G. IGF2, GNASAS, INSIGF, LEP) WITH DIFFERENT PRE- AND POST-NATAL GROWTH PATTERNS
